meanings.definition: To join or connect with a hyphen.
meanings.sent1: She hyphened the two words together to form a compound word.
meanings.sent2: The writer always hyphened compound nouns for clarity.
meanings.sent3: The teacher hyphened the words so fast, it looked like a magic trick!
meanings.sent4: Her kindness hyphened our hearts, creating a strong bond.
meanings.sent5: The hyphened words stood out on the page, making them easy to spot.

meanings.sent1: The document had a hyphened title at the top.
meanings.sent2: She noticed the hyphened words in the list of compound adjectives.
meanings.sent3: The hyphened dress caught everyone's attention at the party.
meanings.sent4: The hyphened road sign pointed towards the city center.
meanings.sent5: The hyphened words on the sign were clear and easy to read from a distance.
